00030 enum MmiSimMsgId {
00031     MmiSimDisplayUpdateHeaderId = 1,
00032     MmiSimDisplayUpdateDataId = 2,
00033     MmiSimBacklightStateId = 10,
00034     MmiSimVibrationStateId = 11,
00035     MmiSimLedStateId = 12,
00036     MmiSimKeyDownId = 200,
00037     MmiSimKeyUpId = 201,
00038     MmiSimCharId = 220,
00039     MmiSimPenDownId = 250,
00040     MmiSimPenUpId = 251,
00041     MmiSimPenMoveId = 252
00042 };
00043 
00044 /*  Each data transfer between MmiSim and simulation environment is a sequence of MmiSimMsgs and 
00045     an optional data buffer, whose length is typically defined by one of the MmiSimMsg's MmiSimMsgArgs.<br />
00046     <br />
00047     Example 1: A DisplayUpdate Notification looks like this:
00048     <pre>
00049     |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00050     | MmiSimMsg                                                                                                                    |
00051     |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00052     | id                    | args[0].t_xydim[0] | args[0].t_xydim[1] | args[1].t_xydim[0] | args[1].t_xydim[1] | args[2].t_uint32 |
00053     |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00054     | DisplayUpdateHeaderId | r_blit_left        | r_blit_top         | r_blit_right       | r_blit_bottom      | data_count       |
00055     |------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00056 
00057     Followed by [data_count] times (in case once we want to support a list of several independent blit rectangles):
00058     |-----------------------------------------------------------| |------| .....
00059     | MmiSimMsg                                                 | | Data | .....
00060     |-----------------------------------------------------------| |------| .....
00061     | id                  | args[0].t_uint32 | args[1].t_uint32 | | .... | .....
00062     |-----------------------------------------------------------| |------| .....
00063     | DisplayUpdateDataId | data_len         | data_offset      | | .... | .....
00064     |-----------------------------------------------------------| |------| .....
00065     </pre>
00066     <br />
00067     Example 2: A BackLight Notification looks like this:
00068 
00069     <pre>
00070     |--------------------------------|
00071     | MmiSimMsg                      |
00072     |--------------------------------|
00073     | id          | args[0].t_uint32 |
00074     |--------------------------------|
00075     | BackLightId | backlight_state  |
00076     |--------------------------------|
00077     </pre>
00078     <br>
00079     This the format for switching the vibration device on and off:
00080     
00081     <pre>
00082     |-------------------------------------------|
00083     | MmiSimMsg                                 |
00084     |-------------------------------------------|
00085     | id                     | args[0].t_uint32 |
00086     |-------------------------------------------|
00087     | MmiSimVibrationStateId |vibration_state   |
00088     |-------------------------------------------|
00089     </pre>
00090     <br>
00091     To handle the LED this message format should be used:
00092     
00093     <pre>
00094     |------------------------------------------------------------|
00095     | MmiSimMsg                                                  |
00096     |------------------------------------------------------------|
00097     | id               | args[0].t_uint32     | args[1].t_uint32 |
00098     |------------------------------------------------------------|
00099     | MmiSimLedStateId | led_state (on / off) | led color (rgb)  |
00100     |------------------------------------------------------------|
00101     </pre>
00102 */
00103 
00105 typedef union {
00106     char t_char[4];
00107     unsigned char t_uchar[4];
00108     unsigned char t_byte[4];
00109     char t_int8[4];
00110     unsigned short t_wchar[2];
00111     short t_int16[2];
00112     unsigned short t_uint[2];
00113     short t_xydim[2];
00114     int t_int32;
00115     unsigned int t_uint32;
00116     int t_int;
00117     void* t_void;
00118 } MmiSimMsgArg;
00119 
00121 // todo: id should be of type MmiSimMsgId. This change must be done synchronously for MmiSim and Apoxi, in order not to break compatibility.
00122 typedef struct {
00123     short id;
00124     MmiSimMsgArg args[4];
00125 } MmiSimMsg;
